t: Blessed*pn is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose*ld sin is covered.
Blessed*ln is the man against whom the Lord*s counts no iniquity, and*ld in whose spirit there is no deceit.
For*pn when I kept silent, my bones wasted away through*ld my groaning all day long.
For*ln day and night your hand was heavy upon me; my*ld strength was dried up as by the heat of summer. Selah*ig
I*pn acknowledged my sin to you, and*ld I did not cover my iniquity; I*ln said, “I will confess my transgressions to the Lord,”*s and*ld you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah*ig
Therefore*pn let everyone who is godly offer*ld prayer to you at a time when you may be found; surely*ln in the rush of great waters, they*ld shall not reach him.
You*ln are a hiding place for me; you*ld preserve me from trouble; you*ld surround me with shouts of deliverance. Selah*ig
I*pn will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I*ld will counsel you with my eye upon you.
Be*ln not like a horse or a mule, without understanding, which*ld must be curbed with bit and bridle, or*ld it will not stay near you.
Many*pn are the sorrows of the wicked, but*ld steadfast love surrounds the one who trusts in the Lord.*s
Be*ln glad in the Lord,*s and rejoice, O righteous, and*ld shout for joy, all you upright in heart!
